MCQ: What is the primary goal of machine learning?
Choices: a: To write software programs by hand. | b: To analyze data without making predictions. | c: To enable computers to learn from data and make predictions. | d: To replace human intelligence entirely.

MCQ: When was the term 'machine learning' first coined?
Which of the following is NOT a common application of machine learning?
Choices: a: Email filtering | b: Predicting stock prices | c: Solving complex mathematical equations | d: Recognizing handwritten text

MCQ: What is the role of 'unsupervised learning' in data mining?
Choices: a: Training a model with labeled data. | b: Making predictions based on existing models. | c: Exploring data to discover patterns without specific guidance. | d: Evaluating the performance of a machine learning model.

MCQ: Who provided a widely used formal definition of machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Alan Turing | c: Donald Hebb | d: Tom M. Mitchell
